column4: wow, FINALLY, i figured out how to kill a fullscreen Wine app without logging in remotely
should be a default option/keypress in gnome imo'
jump to tty2 and do wineserver -killall?
in a fullscreen 3d app in wine you can't do that
GNOME should steal the keypresses to take you to tty2 before they're passed to wine, then the app has lost focus so doesn't get the later ones...
if you've not tried it, don't guess and say it'll work. because it doesn't =/
I have tried it, with portal and HL2, both worked fine
i mean specifcally in 3d apps in wine
strange, I'll take your word for it, what was your solution?
does mass effect use ctrl+alt+f* as a keyboard shortcut in-game?
cos why would keyboard shortcuts work when switching tty (a lower level shortcut) doesn't...?
makes no sense... but what works, works
no clue why ctrl-alt-f1 doesn't work, but it doesn't
nice, but rebooting isn't my idea of elegant, lol
I wasn't suggesting it, I was explaining it
shockwave is old/dying, everyone's moving to flash. why do you need to open aam files?
some things havn't updated to modern technologies (isketch is what prompted this line of investigation but there are others)
